# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    current_line_length = 0
    for word in words
        word_length = length(word)
        if current_line_length + word_length > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        if current_line_length > 0
            wrapped_text *= " "
            current_line_length += 1
        end
        wrapped_text *= word
        current_line_length += word_length
    end
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example
text = "Julia is a high-level, high-performance, dynamic programming language."
println(wrap_string(text, 20))
```

This function `wrap_string` iterates over the words in the input `text` and adds them to the result string, ensuring that each line does not exceed the specified `text_width`. If adding another word would exceed the limit, it starts a new line.
